basics.name: Soumyaranjan Dash
basics.label: Solar Physics Postdoctoral Fellow
basics.summary: A theoretical physicist with a strong background in solar physics, specializing in understanding the origin and dynamics of solar magnetic fields. I have experience in developing and running numerical simulations, analyzing observational data, and writing scientific papers. I am passionate about understanding the fundamental processes that govern the behavior of the Sun and other stars.

work.name: Institute for Astronomy, University of Hawaii
work.summary: Conducting research on the origin and dynamics of solar magnetic fields using numerical simulations and observational data analysis. Writing scientific papers and presenting results at conferences.

courses: PhD Thesis: MODELLING THE EVOLUTION OF SOLAR CORONAL MAGNETIC FIELDS AND ITS HELIOSPHERIC CONSEQUENCES

publications.name: Ensemble Kalman Filter Data Assimilation into the Surface Flux Transport Model to Infer Surface Flows: An Observing System Simulation Experiment
publications.summary: We present an observing system simulation experiment to assess the feasibility of assimilating surface magnetic field observations into the surface flux transport model using the ensemble Kalman filter.

publications.name: Long-term forcing of the Sun's coronal field, open flux, and cosmic ray modulation potential during grand minima, maxima, and regular activity phases by the solar dynamo mechanism
publications.publisher: Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society
publications.summary: We investigate the impact of the Sun's magnetic field field, open flux, and cosmic ray modulation potential during grand minima, maxima, and regular activity phases using solar dynamo model and PFSS extrapolations.

publications.name: Prediction of the Sun's Coronal Magnetic Field and Forward-modeled Polarization Characteristics for the 2019 July 2 Total Solar Eclipse
publications.summary: We present a forward modeling study of the Sun's coronal magnetic field and polarization characteristics for the 2019 July 2 total solar eclipse using the SFT simulations and PFSS model.

projects.name: Solar surface magnetic field evolution
projects.summary: Developed a surface flux transport model to simulate the evolution of the Sun's surface magnetic field over multiple solar cycles.

projects.name: Solar coronal magnetic field dynamics
projects.summary: Utilizing SFT model generated surface megnatic fields, global coronal magnetic field configuration can be inferred using global coronal magnetic field.

projects.name: Coronal magnetic fields
projects.summary: Observations of solar corona at selective emission lines are used for constraining the coronal magnetic field configuration. Polarization vectors are computed using global MHD model outputs and forward modeled to compare with observations.
